Understate: The claim underestimates the purpose and function of the Central Park hospital tents, which were actually set up to treat coronavirus patients, not abused children.
Lack enough support: There is no evidence or credible sources provided to support the claim that thousands of abused children were released from underground captivity in Central Park.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Central Park hospital tents were used for housing abused children, which is not supported by any factual information.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation for the purpose of the Central Park hospital tents, stating that they were used to treat coronavirus patients transferred from Mount Sinai hospitals.
